title: Forgot Password function
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the login page
AND Forgot Password label has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on Forgot Password
custom_expected:
THEN the large InsideMLB logo is replaced by the small logo
AND all fields and labels disappear from the blue box
AND a new label appears in bold-faced white that reads: Please fill in your email address
AND a new white box field appears
AND a gray prompt inside the field reads: Your Email...
AND the label and box are left aligned
AND below the box is a blue button with white border and white all-caps label: Submit
AND the button is horizontally centered

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19397)

title: Global Search for an event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the site
AND the Search field appears in the header
custom_steps:
WHEN user uses the header Search field to search for a specific event by title
AND Search results show that event in the list
AND the event title is linked
custom_expected:
THEN page redirects within the same tab to that event's individual page
AND it is the page with the blue Follow button
AND it is NOT the page with red Maybe and Join buttons
AND it is NOT the page with a simple list, no buttons, no image.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19508)

title: Search Results - document select
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on a Search Results page
AND a list of documents have appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on a document title
custom_expected: THEN page redirects within the same tab to the relevant page within a Department

title: Search for a Department Only document
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is not a member of a certain Department
custom_steps:
WHEN user searches for a document in that Department
AND the document is permissioned Department Only

[To identify a Department Only document, login with lrbatowner@mlb.com / liferay]
custom_expected: THEN user does not see that document in the search results.

title: Events carousel function: automatic slide
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the main page
AND events carousel has appeared
AND carousel has more than one event element
custom_steps: WHEN user waits 5 seconds
custom_expected:
THEN the visible event element slides left offscreen
AND the next event element slides left into the frame

title: Events carousel function: manual slide
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the main page
AND events carousel has appeared
AND carousel has more than one event element
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps the left nav arrow 
OR user clicks or taps on the right nav arrow
custom_expected:
THEN the carousel slides to the previous event (for the left arrow)
OR carousel slides to the next event (for the right arrow)

title: Events carousel: event expires
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user creates an event
AND user has marked the event as Featured
AND user navigates to the main page
AND the event appears in the Featured Events carousel
custom_steps: WHEN the event's End Time arrives
custom_expected:
THEN the event disappears from the carousel within 5 minutes of its End Time
AND the event is still listed on the Global Events page

title: Grid select
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
AND the grid of boxes has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps each box
custom_expected:
THEN page redirects within the same tab to the Department Home page that matches that selected box

(Test all boxes)

title: Grid - no gaps
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Departments page
custom_steps: WHEN user changes viewports
custom_expected: THEN there are no gaps among the Department boxes in the grid at any viewport

title: Global Events - change view - default
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND the table and grid buttons appear at the top of the page
custom_expected:
THEN the grid button is white by default
AND the page shows a grid of event boxes by default.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19592)

title: Global Events - table view
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND the grid of event boxes appears
AND the table and grid buttons appear at the top of the page
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks or taps on the table button
custom_expected:
THEN the table button turns white
AND its icon turns red
AND the grid button turns red with a white icon
AND the grid of boxes changes to a table
AND the table has four columns: Event Name, Location, Start Date, End Date
AND the table's cells contain information for events
AND all events that were in the grid are in the table
AND the events are in order of Start Date
AND event titles are underlined.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19620)

title: Global Events - select event from table
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND user has selected the table view
AND all the events appear in the table
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks or taps on an event name
custom_expected: THEN page redirects within the same tab to that event's individual page.

title: Global Events - table view - sort
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Events page
AND user selects the table button 
AND the table view of events appears
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on any column header (except Location)
custom_expected:
THEN the events change order, with the rows sorted alphabetically or numerically by the data in that selected column
AND clicking on the column header a second time reverses the sorting.

title: Event page - Welcome/Attendees toggle
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an event page
AND user was the creator of that event
AND the Welcome/Attendees toggle has appeared
AND the Welcome is underlined by default

[For any test case that requires Owner/Creator privileges, use login lrbatowner@mlb.com, pw liferay]
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Attendees option in the toggle
custom_expected:
THEN Welcome loses its underline
AND Attendees gains an underline
AND below the header box the Overview, Attend button, and logistics box disappear
AND below the header box a chart appears
AND the chart has 4 headers: First Name, Last Name, Department, Job Title
AND the user's information appears correctly in the first row of the chart

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19504)

title: Event page - Attendees chart
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an event page
AND user did not create the event
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps on the "I will attend" button

AND WHEN user logs out and logs back in as the creator of the event
AND user navigates to that event page
AND user clicks or taps on Attendees in the toggle
AND the Attendees chart appears
custom_expected:
THEN the non-creator user's name appears in a row in the chart
AND all of the non-creator user's information is correct.

title: Event page - Attendees chart - Follower
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an event page
AND user did not create the event
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps on the Follow button

AND WHEN user logs out and logs back in as the creator of the event
AND user navigates to that event page
AND user clicks or taps on Attendees in the toggle
AND the Attendees chart appears
custom_expected: THEN the non-creator user's name does not appear in a row in the chart.

title: Event page - Attendees chart - sort
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is a Department Owner
AND user is on the Global Events page
AND user selects an event the user created 
AND the event's individual page appears
AND user selects the Attendees view
AND the Attendees chart appears
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on a column header
custom_expected:
THEN the attendees change order, with the rows sorted alphabetically by the data in that selected column
AND clicking on the column header a second time reverses the sorting.

title: Event page - Overview - hover menu
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
custom_steps:
WHEN user hovers cursor over the Overview header
OR user hovers cursor over the description
custom_expected:
THEN a nav bar appears, labeled: Web Content Display
AND at the right in the nav bar is a plus icon (+) and a 3-dot dropdown link

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19366)

title: Event page - Add Overview description
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an Event page
AND user is the owner who created that Event
AND directions have appeared beneath the Overview header
AND user has tapped or hovered over the directions text
AND the Web Content Display menu has appeared
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps on the plus sign in the Web Content Display menu
AND a popup with 3 items appears
AND user clicks or taps on the item: Simple Event Overview Structure
custom_expected:
THEN the New Simple Event Overview Structure modal appears

AND WHEN user adds text to the Title field
AND user adds text to the Event Overview field
AND user selects Publish
THEN the modal disappears
AND on the Event page, beneath the Overview header, the user's text has replaced the directions
AND the new title entered into the modal doesn't appear anywhere (the header shows the same title as before) 

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19304)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/19303)

title: Event page - Follow - function
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
custom_steps: WHEN user taps or clicks on the Follow button
custom_expected:
THEN label on the button changes to Unfollow
AND user receives an email from inside@mlb.com that they have followed the event
AND the subject line of the email is: Message about the item you are following
AND the body of the email is: You are following the item [event title]. You will be notified on any updates to this item.

title: Event page - Will Attend - function
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND an "I Will Attend" button is displayed
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the I Will Attend button
custom_expected:
THEN the button label changes to: I Will NOT Attend
AND the user receives an email from inside@mlb.com confirming their registration
AND the subject line of the email is: Save the Date - [Start Date] [Start Time] - [Event Title]
AND the body of the email is (see below)
AND the email has an .ics attachment
AND opening the attachment adds the event to the user's Outlook calendar
AND the dates and times in the user's calendar are correct
AND the URL in the body of the email redirects to the event's individual page on the InsideMLB site.

Body of the email:
Thank you for registering for the event - [event title]. 
Please open the attached .ics file to add the event to your Outlook calendar.
For more information on this event, click here: [URL of event's individual page]

title: Event page - Not Attend - function
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND user has already chosen to Attend the event
AND button appears with the label "I will not attend"
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the I Will Not Attend button
custom_expected:
THEN the button label changes to: I Will Attend
AND user is unregistered from the event
AND user receives an email from inside@mlb.com noting that
AND the subject line of the email is: You are no longer attending [event title]
AND the body of the email is:
[event title] has been canceled or you have unregistered from this event. 
Please open the attached .ics file to remove the event from your Outlook calendar.

AND the email has an .ics attachment

[The following will happen on a Windows platform but not a Mac:]
AND opening the attachment deletes the event entry from the user's Outlook calendar

title: Event page - Update Event - Owner function
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND the user is the event owner
AND the Update button has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Update button
custom_expected:
THEN the same modal as the Add Event modal pops up
AND the modal is correctly pre-populated with the previously entered information [especially check start and end dates, start and end times]
AND user can change or add information in any field (1. Description, 2. Max Attendees, 3. Location, 4. Start and end date, 5. start and end time, 6. Name)
AND user can click or tap on the Update Event button
AND the new details that they entered are saved
AND the new details replace previous values on the individual event page



![](index.php?/attachments/get/19307)

title: Event page - event updates in calendar
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND user is the owner of that event
custom_steps:
WHEN user successfully updates the event's dates
OR WHEN user successfully updates the event's start time
AND user navigates to the Global Calendar page
custom_expected: THEN any change the user just made appears in the event on the calendar

title: Event page - Update for Followers
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user has followed an event
custom_steps: WHEN the owner of the event updates any detail of the event
custom_expected:
THEN the user receives an email from inside@mlb.com about the change that was made
AND the subject line of the email is: Message about the item you are following
AND the body of the email is:
Event [event title] has been updated. Please click the link to view the events page [URL]
AND the URL redirects to the event's individual page on InsideMLB

title: Event page - Update for Attendees
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user has registered for an event (selected the I Will Attend button)
custom_steps: WHEN the owner of the event makes any change to the event
custom_expected:
THEN the user receives an email from inside@mlb.com about the change
AND the subject line of the email is: [event title] has been updated
AND the body of the email is (see below)
AND the email has an .ics attachment
AND opening the attachment adds the changes to the user's Outlook calendar
AND a change in date will move the entry in the calendar (so that there is not an old entry and a new entry at the same time)
AND the dates, times, location, and title in the user's calendar match the changes that were made
AND the URL in the email redirects to the event's individual page in InsideMLB.

Body of the email:
[Event creator's name] has updated [event title].
Please open the attached .ics file to add the event to your Outlook calendar.
For more information on this event, click here: [URL]

title: Event page - Delete Event - popup
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND is the event owner
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the Delete Event button
custom_expected:
THEN a popup appears
AND the popup has a dark blue header box
AND the header box has a white all-caps header: Delete Event
AND below the header box is a message: Are you sure you want to delete?
AND below the message to the left is a dark blue button with a white all-caps label: OK
AND below the message to the right is a red button with a white all-caps label: Cancel

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19282)

title: Event page - Delete Event - popup OK
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on an individual event page
AND user has selected the Delete Event button
AND the delete popup has appeared
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the OK button
custom_expected:
THEN user is redirected back to the Global Events page
AND the event no longer appears in the grid of events

AND WHEN user navigates to the Global Calendar page
THEN the event no longer appears on the calendar

AND WHEN user navigates to the Main Page
IF the event was a Featured Event
THEN it no longer appears in the carousel of events at the top of the page.

title: Event page - Delete for Followers
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user has Followed an event
custom_steps: WHEN that event is deleted
custom_expected:
THEN user receives an email from inside@mlb.com
AND the subject line of the email is: Message about the item you are following
AND the body of the email is:
[event title] has been canceled or it expired.
You are no longer following this event.

title: Event page - Delete for Attendees

custom_expected:

[event title] has been canceled or you have unregistered from this event. 
Please open the attached .ics file to remove the event from your Outlook calendar.

AND the email has an .ics attachment

[The following will happen on a Windows platform but not a Mac:]
AND opening the attachment deletes the event entry from the user's Outlook calendar

title: Right nav function: add Department link
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user has clicked on Departments in the left-side nav
AND the Global Departments page has loaded
AND user has clicked on a Department
AND the correct Department home page has loaded
AND the Department home page has a red button with the label Follow
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps on the red button labeled Follow
AND user clicks on Home in the left-side nav or the InsideMLB logo in the header
custom_expected:

title: Right nav function: remove Department link
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user has clicked on Departments in the left-side nav
AND the Global Departments page has loaded
AND user has clicked on a Department
AND the correct Department home page has loaded
AND the Department home page has a red button with the label Unfollow
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps on the red button labeled Unfollow
AND user clicks on Home in the left-side nav or the InsideMLB logo in the header
custom_expected:
THEN main page loads in the same tab
AND right-side nav appears
AND in the right-side nav the name of the Department user Unfollowed is not visible
